column4: hi all - I have a HP ProLiant G6 server and can not get Hardy Server LTS 64bit to detect the network card.  Knoppix and 9.04 detect it and use it fine...how can i get the drivers from 9,04 into the LTS 8.04 install???
i contacted Ubuntu Support BEFORE i purchased the Five Thousand dollar server and they said that 8.04 would work on it fine.
have searched google with tne name of the nic and 8.04 server edition?
maybe someone else had the same problem already solved
- yeah i have and everyone is having the same issues

- apparently hardy 8.04-4 is meant to have a fix but I cant find where you download this build.  The lasted build i can find is alternate CD 8.04-3.  Going by the release date calendar onthe canonical site 8.04-4 isnt due until 2010
have seen that on ubuntuusers.de yesterday that 8.04.4 will released 2010
- yeah...is there any way of copying the drivers from the 9.04 install CD into the hardy disk so it can power up the network card.
- i have purchased another G6 server after consulting canonical (this one cost me $6K) and im thinking im going to have very expensive paper weights
- drivers are built for RHEL and SLED only
i dont know how to build kernel-moduls (drivers) for a nic, sorry
- a lot of the packages I want to install on this server are commercial grade and as such are only built for Enterpise Servers - of which Ubuntu LTS is meant to be
- debian 5 isnt listed as a supported platform
ok didnt know ubuntu-server-edition is a enterprise-linux-version
- yeah Server LTS is meant to be ubuntu answer to SUSE Enterprise and RHEL
